intro: Eriosema campestre f. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy田野豆, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features a sprawling growth habit with numerous hairy stems that are often reddish in color. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptical, and covered with fine, soft hairs, giving the plant its "hairy" appearance. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, typical of the Fabaceae family. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
